Dear Ms. Cheatham:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation Allegation 1:
It was discovered that the foster parent smoked marijuana with the
youth and had provided the youth access to marijuana for the
youth to smoke. It was reported that the foster care worker
became aware of this youth’s marijuana use upon placement and
within weeks developed a plan with the foster parent and the
youth for the youth to access and use marijuana. This included the
foster parent being the one to provide marijuana to the youth, and
a reward system that if the youth followed the rules, the youth
would be allowed marijuana.
Allegation 2:
The foster care worker contacted the foster parent to advise her
about the special evaluation and or what to say when interviewed.
Investigation Interviews:
Allegation 1
2

Complainant
On 7/18/2024 I interviewed the complainant by telephone.
Information reported was as reported by the Licensing worker.
Licensing Worker (LW)
On 7/18/2024 I interviewed Licensing Worker (LW) by telephone.
LW reported he became aware of the allegations during a special
evaluation he was conducting on Foster Parent 1 related to a
complaint alleging Foster Parent 1 was smoking marijuana with
Youth A. He interviewed both Foster Parent 1 and Youth A
LW reported when he interviewed Foster Parent 1, a young foster
parent who had only been fostering for six months, Foster Parent
1 denied smoking marijuana with Youth A. Foster Parent 1
admitted Youth A’s foster care worker told her that Youth A had a
history of marijuana and alcohol use. Because of that, Foster
Parent 1 said she initially refused to allow Youth A to smoke.
Foster Parent 1 admitted there came a time she allowed Youth A
to smoke marijuana. Foster Parent 1 reported she took Youth A to
a friend’s home, where Youth A was given marijuana and allowed
to smoke. Foster Parent 1 said she facilitated the situation and
monitored Youth A’s marijuana smoking. LW said Foster Parent 1
reported she did so, because when she had expressed concern
about Youth A smoking marijuana to Foster Care Worker (FCW),
FCW made it seem as though it was not a big issue or concern.
When she mentioned the possibility of allowing Youth A to smoke
with supervision, FCW was okay with it. FCW reported if Youth A
has to smoke to make sure it was done responsibly. Foster Parent
1 reported after that she developed rules to make sure Youth A’s
marijuana use was safe, as opposed to Youth A using it with
peers without supervision. LW said Foster Parent 1 told him she
monitored Youth A’s marijuana usage on two occasions, in May
2024. LW said Foster Parent 1 told him there was a third occasion
around 6/7/2024, when Youth A had stolen a joint and smoked it
without her supervision. Foster Parent 1 reported when Youth A
smoked the stolen joint without her supervision, Youth A was
breaking the rules they had established. Foster Parent 1 then took
away Youth A’s supervised marijuana usage, and she took away
Youth A’s phone. LW did not report whether Foster Parent 1
indicated discussing her decision to remove Youth A’s marijuana
smoking privilege with FCW. Foster Parent 1 said the agreement
for Youth A’s marijuana usage was verbal, nothing was written
out.
LW reported during his interview with Youth A, Youth A reported
she and Foster Parent 1 smoked marijuana at Foster Parent 1’s
3

friend’s house twice during the month of May 2024. Youth A
reported there were rules established around when she would be
allowed to smoke. That being when Foster Parent 1 was around
and could supervise her. Provided she had been following house
and school rules and expectations.
Youth A:
On 7/19/2024 Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS)
Worker, LW and I interviewed Youth A (age17) onsite at the
agency. Youth A affirmed information reported by LW related to
his licensing interview with her related to there being an
agreement with the foster parent around her smoking marijuana.
Youth A reported she smoked marijuana with Foster Parent 1
once at Foster Parent 1’s best friend, Person B’s house. Youth A
said, Person B brought out a joint and they all passed it around
and smoked it. Youth A reported after a while her placement with
Foster Parent 1 became difficult, because she was not following
the household rules, and she did not like how Foster Parent 1 was
talking to her. She said she smoked marijuana once at school, but
then she started smoking marijuana in the backyard. She also
stole a joint from Person B and smoked it. She said, there came a
time when Foster Parent 1 made a big deal about her smoking
when she had not, and so she thought Foster Parent 1 was
teasing her. She said Foster Parent 1 never told her not to tell
that she was smoking marijuana. And Foster Parent 1 never
forced her to use marijuana, because she could have said no,
when asked to smoke.
Youth A reported FCW never knew she was smoking “weed” with
Foster Parent 1. She reported not knowing whether Foster Parent
1 told FCW they were smoking weed or smoking it in the
backyard. She denied knowing exactly how FCW became aware
of her smoking marijuana. She said maybe FCW and Foster
Parent 1 were texting about it. She stated that FCW knew weed
smoking was a part of her past, from her prior placement, not that
she was smoking with Foster Parent 1. She denied smoking came
up during FCW’s visits to Foster Parent 1’s home.
Youth A also denied that anyone told her what to say during her
interview with us today. She said the person who developed a
safety plan with her around the marijuana was Foster Parent 1,
and that it occurred around May 2024.
DHHS Worker & LW
On 7/19/2024 following Youth A’s onsite agency interview, LW
and DHHS reported information to me related to the allegations.
4

LW reported Youth A’s statement today had changed from what
was reported to him in an earlier interview. Youth A, FCW and
Foster Parent 1 seemed to be uniting and changing their stories
about FCW’s awareness of Youth A’s marijuana usage and Foster
Parent 1’s involvement. He reported there is a text message
between FCW and Foster Parent 1, where FCW appears to give
Foster Parent 1 a head’s up about the foster home investigation.
Additionally, DHHS Worker reported that FCW took Youth A out
for a meeting just prior to Youth A’s interview with us today. The
concern was whether Youth A may have been coached by FCW
after FCW was told not to have further contact with Youth A
pending the completion of the investigation. DHHS Worker and
LW also reported it came to the agency’s attention that on
7/5/2024 FCW confided to a coworker, Family Preservation
Assistant (FPA) that she had knowledge of Youth’s A marijuana
drug use.
Family Preservation Assistant (FPA)
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW and I interviewed FPA onsite at
the agency. FPA reported being an Intern with the agency. She
reported FCW knew Youth A was smoking marijuana. She said
on 7/5/204 FCW came to her office, and they chatted about how
Youth A was doing. At that time, FCW told her Youth A was upset
with Foster Parent 1 because Foster Parent 1 won’t let her smoke
weed with her anymore. That Youth A was feeling Foster Parent 1
was teasing her, that this happened after Foster Parent 1 caught
her smoking and drinking and became upset with her. FPA said
FCW told her Youth A and Foster Parent 1 used to smoke
together. FPA reported after FCW shared this information with
her, she asked FCW whether that was illegal and FCW responded
“it was in a supervised environment”. FPA said she told FCW that
behavior was inappropriate. FCW responded “I don’t know, I can’t
deal with it,” and FCW did not want to talk about the matter
further.
FPA said FCW never told her that FCW had smoked marijuana.
Nor was there a conversation between her and FCW as to
whether FCW reported the matter of Foster Parent 1 smoking
marijuana with Youth A to the agency supervisor or another
administrative staff. FPA took it upon herself to report the matter
to Foster Care Supervisor on 7/8/2024. FPA said sometime later
FCW confronted her about the fact that she reported the matter to
FCS.
Foster Care Worker (FCW)
5

On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW and I interviewed FCW onsite at
the agency. FCW’s demeanor during the interview is worth noting
due to the fact she often laughed or smirked at various questions
put forth to her, and she raised her voice when answering or
remarking or rolled her eyes at remarks or questions that we
raised.
FCW reported being Youth A’s case worker. She reported
becoming aware of Youth A’s past marijuana use at a TDM (Team
Decision Meeting) in October 2023 while Youth A was placed with
her brother. The brother brought up Youth A’s drug use at the
meeting, because he was concerned with Youth A smoking while
on certain medications. FCW said she took the matter up with the
youth’s therapist. She reported the therapist basically reported it
was okay. The therapist reported that although smoking marijuana
was not a good coping mechanism, Youth A will continue to use
any way given her age. FCW reported the agency team members
all knew Youth A had a past history of smoking marijuana. She
said she had several conversations with Youth A about good
coping mechanisms other than marijuana use. She reported she
had safety planned with Youth A around her marijuana issue, but
later during this interview she changed her reporting and said she
had not.
FCW denied knowledge of Youth A and Foster Parent 1 smoking
marijuana together. She reported Youth A was placed with Foster
Parent 1 in April 2024. She told Foster Parent 1 about Youth A’s
marijuana drug use as a part of Youth A’s past history, but that
Youth A was not actively using marijuana. She reported since
Youth A’s marijuana use was a past history issue, she did not
expand on the matter further with Foster Parent 1. She reported in
May 2024 Foster Parent 1 told her that she had caught Youth A
with marijuana after school. FCW did not know where Youth A
was getting the marijuana from. Foster Parent 1 did not know
either. FCW admitted a safety plan was not discussed or
completed with Foster Parent 1 and Youth A at that time. She
stated she might have completed a social work contact about her
conservation with the foster parent. She reported in June 2024,
during a foster home visit, Foster Parent 1 reported finding Youth
A with marijuana again, to which Youth A initially said she found it,
then that it was taken from the Foster Parent 1’s friend. FCW
admitted she did not speak with or confront Youth A about her
marijuana use at this time. Nor did she discuss or complete a
safety plan.
6

FCW denied condoning Youth A’s marijuana use. She denied
condoning or giving an okay for a plan by Foster Parent 1 to
smoke with or supervise Youth A’s marijuana use. FCW was
asked whether Youth A ever told her she and Foster Parent 1
smoked weed together and FCW stated “Not that I can recall”.
When asked whether she ever texted Foster Parent 1 about the
foster parent and Youth A smoking marijuana, FCW said, “No”.
Foster Parent 2
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW and I interviewed Foster Parent
2 onsite at the agency. Foster Parent 2 reported Youth A was a
respite placement with her. She reported her initial awareness of
Youth A’s marijuana drug use came from Youth A. Youth A told
her Youth A’s therapist was in agreement with it, that marijuana
use was a coping mechanism for her. Youth A told her that when
she smoked marijuana, she smoked with Foster Parent 1, and
Foster Parent 1’s friend. Foster Parent 2 said she immediately
“shut that down”. She told Youth A that her smoking marijuana
was not something that will happen at her home. Foster Parent 2
said on 7/11/2024, she messaged FCW about what Youth A
reported. FCW told her she does not sit in on Youth A’s therapist
sessions but what Youth A reported was what she understood to
be correct. FCW mentioned knowing that Foster Parent 1 had
allowed Youth A to smoke marijuana in Foster Parent 1’s home.
FCW mentioned it as a concern, but FCW did not report what was
done about it. Foster Parent 2 reported FCW understood that
allowing Youth A to smoke weed was not something she would
allow. FCW advised her to go ahead and enforced her rule to not
allow Youth A’s marijuana use.
Foster Parent 1
On 7/22/2024 and 7/23/2024 I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by
telephone. Foster Parent 1 provided additional information to me
via email on 7/26/2024. Foster Parent 1 affirmed Youth A’s
placement with her occurring in April 2024. She denied several
times that she smoked marijuana with Youth A but admitted to
allowing and supervising Youth A’s use of marijuana at least
twice. She also denied providing the marijuana to Youth A. She
admitted she had smoked in front of Youth A, while they were at
the same location. She indicated she was in the garage and Youth
A would come out occasionally. Foster Parent 1 could not recall if
she told FCW this, but she reported she had told FCW Youth A
had stolen weed from her friend, Person B.
Foster Parent 1 reported the initial information told to her about
Youth A was that Youth A had an issue of running away, and that
7

she cognitively functioned like a 13-year-old. She said she also
received written paperwork on Youth A that showed information,
that when Youth A was in placement with her brother, Youth A
would sneak out and smoke marijuana with her peers. Foster
Parent 1 said she asked FCW it, but FCW did not indicate what
Foster Parent 1 should do if Youth A started smoking marijuana
again. Foster Parent 1 said there did come a time that Youth A
started smoking marijuana, which was sometime in May 2024.
Youth A told FCW that Youth A got marijuana from a friend and
FCW informed Foster Parent 1 of this information. She said there
also came a time that Youth A reported finding a joint, but it was
later revealed Youth A stole the marijuana joint from Person B.
Foster Parent 1 said FCW did not tell her how to address the
issue or what to do with Youth A on the matter of Youth A smoking
marijuana. Foster Parent 1 stated, “I was sort of left to decide the
punishment.” She reported she allowed Youth A to smoke
marijuana. She explained she made an agreement with Youth A
that if Youth A followed the rules, Youth A could smoke marijuana
at Person B’s, if Person B decided to smoke. Foster Parent 1
reported that during a visit to Person B’s home, Person B decided
to smoke marijuana, so Youth A was allowed to smoke with
Person B. Person B provided the marijuana. Foster Parent 1
denied engaging in smoking marijuana with Youth A and Person B
at that time. She supervised/monitored Youth A’s marijuana
smoking. She admitted there may have been other guests during
that event because Person B usually had other friends, who are of
age, over to her home. Foster Parent 1 admitted there was at
least one other occasion, that occurred about two weeks after the
first event, where she allowed and supervised Youth A smoking
marijuana at Person B’s home. Foster Parent 1 said it was one
joint and Youth A was allowed to take puffs because Youth A had
been behaving and following the rules.
Foster Parent 1 said there came a time she shared what she was
doing/had done with FCW. She said she discussed the matter with
FCW during a home visit. She said she discussed it with FCW
more than once. She was not sure if she reported Youth A’s
smoking was allowed as a reward, but she surmised she had. She
said FCW usually came out when Youth A had behavior issues,
and she would tell FCW what she was planning about Youth A’s
behavior, so she may have told FCW the weed smoking was a
reward. Foster Parent 1 did not recall what FCW said, but FCW
did not object, tell her not to do it, or that it was against the
rules. Foster Parent 1 reported she took this to mean it was okay
for her to do it.
8

She reported allowing Youth A to smoke weed was not her initial
intention. When Youth A first came to her home, she told
Youth A there would be no smoking and no drinking. After Youth A
was sneaking and using and not being truthful, she didn’t see the
point in fighting with Youth A about it and with no objection to it
from FCW she took it to mean it was okay for Youth A to smoke
marijuana. She thinks now FCW is trying to set her up.
Foster Parent 1 reported Youth A never told her directly that
FCW was okay with her smoking weed, but Youth A implied that.
Foster Parent 1 reported when Youth A was pushing her to allow
her to smoke weed, Youth A said, “I don’t know what the big deal
is, I smoked “with FCW in FCW’s care”. Foster Parent 1 said
Youth A mentioned that after the first time Foster Parent 1 allowed
Youth A to smoke weed. Youth A did not report when that
situation occurred with FCW and Foster Parent 1 never asked
FCW about what Youth A alleged.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS)
On 7/24/2024 FCS was interviewed by DHHS Worker and me via
TEAMS, with Chief Administrator present. I also reviewed FCS
emails related to her contact with FPA and FCW on 7/8/2024.
FCS reported being aware of Youth A’s past marijuana use not
that Youth A had been using in Foster Parent 1’s home.
She reported similar information as FCW related to what Youth
A’s brother had reported about Youth A’s marijuana use. FCS said
when Youth A was replaced to Foster Parent 1 home, Youth A
was away from her prior school and classmates, and it was
believed her use and ability to gain access to the substance had
stopped. FCS reported, up until FPA brought the matter to her
attention on 7/8/2024 she was not aware that Youth A was
currently smoking marijuana or that Foster Parent 1 was allowing
it or smoking with her. Likewise, she did not know Foster Parent 1
had an okay from FCW to allow Youth A to smoke marijuana or to
smoke it supervised. FCS said FCW never shared this information
with her, nor came directly to her to talk about Youth A smoking
marijuana or any concerns in that area. She said if FCW had
brought it up she would have addressed the issue appropriately.
She said on 7/8/2024 she spoke with FCW and FCW would not
directly answer her questions about the matter. FCW said “We all
knew Youth A had a history of smoking marijuana”. FCS reported
no knowledge of an FTM where a therapist or anyone approved
Youth A’s use of marijuana or tobacco as a coping mechanism.
She reported that would not be something the agency would
condone.
9

Therapist
On 8/6/2024 I interviewed Therapist by telephone. Therapist
reported she provided biweekly therapy for Youth A from
10/22/2023 until 6/19/2024. Therapist reported her contact with
Youth A and the foster parent was trauma focused around safety
due to Youth A having suicidal ideations during moments of crisis.
She said she had contact with FCW in late April around getting an
emergency assessment for Youth A because Youth A had made
some suicidal statements. She reported there was not an initial
treatment goal established around substance use for Youth A.
She said there never were any goals established around Youth A’s
marijuana use because Youth A continued to deny marijuana use.
Therapist affirmed there had been an FTM, which she reported
was on 9/15/2023, where the caregiver at that time, reported he
found marijuana on Youth A and he took it away. Therapist said
there was nothing specific related to Youth A’s substance use
after that. She said education was provided about substance
use, and there was discussion about positive coping mechanisms,
but there was never a discussion with Youth A, her foster
parent, and FCW about Youth A being allowed to use marijuana
under supervision as a coping mechanism. Therapist reported that
is not something she would ever recommend or condone.
Therapist reported her last contact with FCW was in June 2024.
Documents Reviewed
Youth A’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
• Youth A is a permanent court ward.
• She was placed in Foster Parent 1’s home on 4/29/2024
and was replaced on 7/18/2024 to Foster Parent 2’s foster
home.
• She was place at Vista Maria on 7/31/2024
Foster Parent 1’s special evaluation report which indicated: the
admissions as reported by Youth A and Foster Parent 1. That the
special evaluation found the foster home in violation of the foster
home applicant qualification rule; and the agency recommended
revocation of Foster Parent 1’s foster home license.
Emails as referred to in the narrative section of this report.
FCW/the agency provided two safety plans for Youth A, but
neither safety plans were for marijuana use/issues.
Allegation 2
DHHS Worker & LW
On 7/19/2024 following Youth A’s onsite interview at the agency
LW and DHHS reported information to me related to a text
10

message where FCW appeared to give Foster Parent 1 a head’s
up about the special evaluation. They also reported concerns that
FCW’s contact with Youth A the day of her interview may have
been to coach Youth A on what to say in her interview and that
this contact occurred after FCW was told not have contact with
Youth A pending the completion of the investigation. It was then
confirmed by Chief Administrator that FCW’s contact with Youth A
was prior to Youth A’s interview with us, and before FCW was
advised to stop her contact with Youth A.
Youth A, Family Preservation Assistant (FPA); Foster Parent
2
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW and I interviewed Youth A, FPA
and Foster Parent 2 onsite at the agency. Neither reported
information related to this allegation. FPA reported she was not
aware of a text between FCW and Foster Parent 1 about a special
evaluation pertaining to Foster Parent 1.
Foster Care Worker (FCW)
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW and I interviewed FCW onsite at
the agency. FCW reported she never texted Foster Parent 1 about
the foster parent and Youth A smoking marijuana. FCW reported
her contacts with Foster Parent 1 were via the agency’s networks.
She denied using her personal phone to text Foster Parent 1
about such or to inform Foster Parent 1 that there was a complaint
against Foster Parent 1. When the DHHS Worker advised FCW
there were screen shots of text messages between her and Foster
Parent 1 where she mentioned Youth A’s marijuana use with
Foster Parent 1 and appeared to advise or coach Foster Parent 1
on what to say when interviewed, FCW acknowledged there was a
text message. FCW reported she was advising Foster Parent 1 of
the special investigation, as a way to show support not to coach or
tell her what to say.
It is noteworthy, the LW reported it is not a FCW’s role to report a
foster home’s complaint/special evaluation allegations to the foster
parent.
Foster Parent 1
On 7/22/2024 and 7/23/2024 I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by
telephone. Foster Parent 1 reported when LW contacted her about
the complaint against her foster home, she texted FCW and told
her LW was coming out to speak with her and Youth A. FCW told
her the allegation was about her and Youth A smoking together.
That she can just let them know she and Youth A do not smoke
together and that everyone knows Youth A smokes. Foster Parent
11

1 said she did not know if FCW “was really telling me what to say”
because she was already going to say that, as it was the truth.
Foster Parent 1 provided me copies of text messages between
her and FCW.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS)
On 7/24/2024 FCS was interviewed by DHHS Worker and me via
TEAMS, with Chief Administrator present. FCS reported foster
care workers are not to contact foster parents about special
evaluations. She reported that is the agency’s practice, and FCW
is well aware that she/a worker is not to give a foster parent a
heads up about any foster home investigation.
Documents Reviewed
Youth A MISACWIS case record which showed
• Information as indicated earlier in this section.
Text messages between Foster Parent 1 and FCW that related to
the foster home complaint allegations that showed:
• Foster Parent 1 texted FCW to say she was not sure if LW
spoke with FCW that LW was coming out to speak with
Youth A about an allegation.
• FCW responded to Foster Parent 1 by telling Foster Parent
1 the allegation is about Youth A and Foster Parent 1
smoking marijuana together. FCW told Foster Parent 1
Youth A reported that to FPA and FPA reported it to LW.
• FCW advised Foster Parent 1 that everyone knows that
Youth A smokes, and the main issue is about them
smoking together, so Foster Parent 1 can just let LW
known she and Youth A don’t smoke together.
• FCW advised Foster parent 1 to not stress about the
allegation, that FCW has already talked to Youth A and
Youth A is maintaining that the two of them don’t smoke
together.
Analysis Allegation 1
Based on reporting by persons interviewed and text messages
reviewed the evidence showed FCW was aware of Youth A’s use
of marijuana in Foster Parent 1’s presence and or together with
her, and she did not intervene to stop it, nor prevent it.
Allegation 2
The evidence showed FCW affirmed to Foster Parent 1 the
reason for the foster home special evaluation pertaining to her
foster home. Additionally, FCW advised Foster Parent 1 on what
to say during the special evaluation with LW, as well as assured
12

Foster Parent 1 that Youth A would maintain the statement of
them not smoking marijuana together.
The evidence showed the worker demonstrated a lack of
character and suitability to meet the needs of children and families
in these instances.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Staff responsibilities.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be directly
Description responsible for all of the following activities:
(a)Placing and supervising children in out-of-home care. Social
services worker shall work directly with the children, their families,
and other relevant individuals and be primarily responsible for the
development, implementation, and review of service plan for the
children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation The worker became aware of the youth’s current marijuana use
and did not develop a safety plan for the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Licensing Worker (LW)
On 7/18/2024 I interviewed LW by telephone. Subsequent contact
was had with him onsite at the agency on 7/19/2024. He reported
during his interview with Foster Parent 1 and Youth A about the
foster home allegations, both Youth A and Foster Parent 1
reported FCW was aware of Youth A’s current marijuana use
while in Foster Parent 1’s care. He reported since his initial
contact with Youth A she appears to be changing her story about
the situation.
Youth A
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW, and I interviewed Youth A
onsite at the agency. Youth A reported FCW never knew she was
smoking “weed” with Foster Parent 1. She denied knowing
exactly how FCW became aware of her smoking marijuana while
in Foster Parent 1’s care. She said maybe FCW and Foster
Parent 1 were texting about it. She stated FCW knew her weed
smoking was a part of her past, from her prior placement, not that
she was smoking with Foster Parent 1. She denied that when
13

FCW came out on home visits to Foster Parent 1’s home that her
smoking ever came up.
Family Preservation Assistant (FPA)
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW, and I interviewed FPA onsite at
the agency. FPA reported FCW knew Youth A was smoking
marijuana. She said on 7/5/2024 FCW came to her office, and
they chatted about how Youth A was doing. FCW told her Youth A
was feeling Foster Parent 1 was teasing her and that this
happened after Foster Parent 1 caught her smoking and drinking
and became upset with her.
Foster Care Worker (FCW)
On 7/19/2024 DHHS Worker, LW and I interviewed FCW onsite at
the agency. FCW reported being aware of Youth A having a past
history of marijuana use going back to October 2023. She
reported in May 2024 Foster Parent 1 told her she had caught
Youth A with marijuana after school. FCW said she spoke with
Youth A about this, about having good coping mechanism, but she
did not know where Youth A was getting the marijuana from.
Foster Parent 1 did not know either. FCW admitted a safety plan
was not discussed or completed with Foster Parent 1 and Youth A
at that time. She stated she might have completed a social work
contact about her conservation with the foster parent. She
reported in June 2024, during a foster home visit, Foster Parent 1
reported finding Youth A with marijuana again. FCW admitted she
did not speak with or confront Youth A about her marijuana use at
this time. Nor did she discuss or complete a safety plan
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS)
On 7/24/2024 FCS was interviewed by DHHS Worker and me via
TEAMS, with Chief Administrator present. I also reviewed FCS
Emails to CA related to her contact with FPA and FCW on
7/8/2024. FCS reported information as reported under Allegation 1
with respect to not knowing Youth A was currently smoking
marijuana or that Foster Parent 1 had an okay from FCW to allow
Youth A to smoke marijuana until FPA brought it to her attention.
She reiterated FCW never shared this information with her. Nor
did FCW answer questions directly when she asked FCW about
this matter. FCW reported being unsure. FCW what a foster
parent is expected to do. FCW asked if Foster Parent 1 went on
the porch and saw Youth A smoking, how was she to stop it, was
she to grab it out of Youth A’s hand?
Foster Parent 1
On 7/22/2024 and 7/23/2024 I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by

telephone. Foster Parent 1 reported FCW was aware that Youth A
was actively using marijuana in May 2024. That FCW was

She had discussed the matter with FCW during a home visit.

Reviewed
• An email from FCS to CA on 7/8/2024 which indicated
concern/ information she obtained from FPA and her follow
up with FCW which basically outlined what she reported
when she was interviewed by us.
• Aside from a 7/18/2024 social work contact indicating FCW
safety planned with Youth A and the new foster parent after
allegations of Youth A’s marijuana smoking with her prior
foster parent, no other social work contact was documented
about safety planning on Youth A’s marijuana use.
• A text message between Foster Parent 1 and FCW on
June 13, 2024, where the two were corresponding about
Youth A wanting to hang out with a friend in the complex
where her brother lives. During the text message Foster
Parent 1 told FCW Youth A was not wanting to take a “pee
test” because Youth A was “smoking” that she “found an
unopened roll” when she was on a walk like a week ago
and she had smoked it once or twice. FCW responded it
would not be good for Youth A to go hang out there
because Youth A knows a lot of people there and to be
unsupervised would not be good. FCW added “Smh
(shaking my head), we told her she wouldn’t be in trouble,
we all know she been smoking”.
Analysis The evidence showed, through reporting by Foster Parent 1, FPA
and FCW, FCW was aware of Youth A’s marijuana use and did
not safety plan with the youth or the foster parent around Youth
A’s continued marijuana use.
In this instance the worker did not work directly with the youth, and
relevant individuals for the development, and implementation, of
the service plan for the youth.
Conclusion Violation Established.

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
